intro: Justicia campechiana, commonly known as the Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
